translation: Intelligence, wisdom, non-delusion, forgiveness, truth, self-control, calmness, happiness, sorrow, birth, death, fear, fearlessness—non-violence, equanimity, contentment, austerity, charity, fame, and infamy—all these diverse states of beings arise from Me alone.

shloka: महर्षयः सप्त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा। मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमाः प्रजाः॥
translation: The seven great sages, the four ancient Manus, and the progenitors of humanity were born from My mind. All the creatures in this world descend from them.

shloka: एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः। सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशयः॥
translation: One who knows in truth this glory and power of Mine is united with Me by unwavering Yoga. Of this there is no doubt.

shloka: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते। इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः॥
translation: I am the origin of all; from Me everything proceeds. Knowing this, the wise worship Me with loving devotion.

shloka: मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव। अहं सलिल एको द्रष्टा अहं विश्वं भुवनं महत्॥
translation: All this universe is strung on Me like pearls on a thread. I am the taste in water, the light in the sun and moon, the sacred syllable Om in all Vedas.

shloka: पिताहमस्य जगतो माता धाता पितामहः। वेद्यं पवित्रमोङ्कार ऋक्साम यजुरेव च॥
translation: I am the father, mother, sustainer, and grandfather of this world. I am the object of knowledge, the purifier, the syllable Om, and the Rig, Sama, and Yajur Vedas.

shloka: गतिर्भर्ता प्रभुः साक्षी निवासः शरणं सुहृत्। प्रभवः प्रलयः स्थानं निधानं बीजमव्ययम्॥
translation: I am the goal, the sustainer, the master, the witness, the abode, the refuge, the friend, the origin, the dissolution, the foundation, the treasure, and the imperishable seed.

shloka: तपाम्यहमहं वर्षं निगृह्णाम्युत्सृजामि च। अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च सदसच्चाहमर्जुन॥
translation: I give heat, I withhold and send rain. I am immortality and death, O Arjuna. I am existence and non-existence.

shloka: अर्जुन उवाच। परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान्। पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम्॥
translation: Arjuna said: You are the Supreme Brahman, the supreme abode, the supreme purifier, the eternal divine Person, the primal God, unborn and all-pervading.

shloka: आहुस्त्वामृषयः सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा। असितो देवलो व्यासः स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे॥
translation: All the sages—Narada, Asita, Devala, Vyasa—proclaim this of You, and now You Yourself declare it to me.

shloka: सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव। न हि ते भगवन्व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवाः॥
translation: O Krishna, I accept as truth all that You have told me. Neither the gods nor the demons, O Lord, know Your manifestations.

shloka: स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम। भूतभावन भूतेश देवदेव जगत्पते॥
translation: Indeed, You alone know Yourself by Yourself, O Supreme Person, origin of all beings, Lord of all beings, God of gods, Lord of the universe!

shloka: वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः। याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि॥
translation: Please describe to me in detail Your divine glories, by which You pervade all these worlds.

shloka: कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन्। केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया॥
translation: O Krishna, how should I meditate on You? In what forms are You to be contemplated by me?

shloka: विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन। भूयः कथय तृप्तिर्हि शृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम्॥
translation: O Janardana, please describe again in detail Your mystic power and glories, for I never tire of hearing Your immortal words.

shloka: श्रीभगवानुवाच। हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः। प्राधान्यतः कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे॥
translation: The Lord said: Very well, I will tell you of My divine glories, O best of the Kurus, but only the most prominent, for there is no end to My manifestations.

shloka: अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः। अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च॥
translation: O Arjuna, I am the Self seated in the hearts of all beings. I am the beginning, the middle, and the end of all beings.

shloka: आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंशुमान्। मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी॥
translation: Among the Adityas, I am Vishnu; among lights, the radiant sun; among the Maruts, I am Marici; among stars, I am the moon.

shloka: वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासवः। इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना॥
translation: Among the Vedas, I am the Sama Veda; among the gods, Indra; among the senses, the mind; among beings, the life force.

shloka: रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम्। वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरुः शिखरिणामहम्॥
translation: Among the Rudras, I am Shiva; among the Yakshas and Rakshasas, Kubera; among the Vasus, I am fire; among mountains, Meru.

shloka: पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम्। सेनानीनामहं स्कन्दः सरसामस्मि सागरः॥
translation: O Arjuna, know Me as Brihaspati, the chief among priests. Among generals, I am Skanda; among bodies of water, I am the ocean.

shloka: महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम्। यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालयः॥
translation: Among the great sages, I am Bhrigu; among words, the single syllable Om; among sacrifices, the chanting of names; among immovable things, the Himalayas.

shloka: अश्वत्थः सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारदः। गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथः सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनिः॥
translation: Among trees, I am the sacred fig; among divine sages, Narada; among Gandharvas, Chitraratha; among perfected beings, the sage Kapila.

shloka: उच्चैःश्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भवम्। ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम्॥
translation: Among horses, know Me as Uchchaihshrava, born of nectar; among lordly elephants, Airavata; among men, the king.

shloka: आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक्। प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्पः सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकिः॥
translation: Among weapons, I am the thunderbolt; among cows, the wish-fulfilling Kamadhenu. I am Kandarpa, the god of love; among serpents, I am Vasuki.

shloka: अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम्। पितॄणामर्यमा चास्मि यमः संयमतामहम्॥
translation: Among the Nagas, I am Ananta; among water deities, Varuna. Among ancestors, I am Aryama; among controllers, Yama.

shloka: प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां कालः कलयतामहम्। मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहं वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम्॥
translation: Among the Daityas, I am Prahlada; among reckoners, time; among beasts, the lion; among birds, Garuda.

shloka: पवनः पवतामस्मि रामः शस्त्रभृतामहम्। झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी॥
translation: Among purifiers, I am the wind; among warriors, Rama. Among fish, I am the shark; among rivers, the Ganges.

shloka: सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन। अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वादः प्रवदतामहम्॥
translation: O Arjuna, I am the beginning, middle, and end of creation. Among sciences, I am spiritual knowledge; among debaters, the reasoned argument.

shloka: अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्वः सामासिकस्य च। अहमेवाक्षयः कालो धाताऽहं विश्वतोमुखः॥
translation: Among letters, I am 'A'; among compound words, the dual. I am inexhaustible time; I am the sustainer facing all directions.

shloka: मृत्युः सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भवश्च भविष्यताम्। कीर्तिः श्रीर्वाक्च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृतिः क्षमा॥
translation: I am all-devouring death, and the origin of future beings. Among feminine qualities, I am fame, beauty, speech, memory, intelligence, steadfastness, and forgiveness.

shloka: बृहत्साम तथा साम्नां गायत्री छन्दसामहम्। मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनां कुसुमाकरः॥
translation: Among hymns, I am the Brihatsama; among poetic meters, Gayatri. Among months, I am Margashirsha; among seasons, spring.

shloka: द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम्। जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम्॥
translation: I am the gambling of cheats, the splendor of the splendid. I am victory, I am effort, I am the goodness of the good.

shloka: वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानां धनञ्जयः। मुनीनामप्यहं व्यासः कवीनामुशना कविः॥
translation: Among the Vrishnis, I am Vasudeva; among the Pandavas, Arjuna. Among sages, I am Vyasa; among poets, the wise Ushana.

shloka: दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम्। मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम्॥
translation: I am the rod of disciplinarians, the strategy of conquerors. Among secrets, I am silence; among the wise, I am wisdom.

shloka: यच्चापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन। न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम्॥
translation: O Arjuna, I am the seed of all beings. Nothing moving or unmoving can exist without Me.

shloka: नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतीनां परन्तप। एष तूद्देशतः प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया॥
translation: O conqueror of foes, there is no end to My divine manifestations. What I have spoken is but a hint of My infinite glories.

shloka: यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा। तत्तदेवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोंऽशसंभवम्॥
translation: Know that whatever is glorious, prosperous, or powerful springs from but a spark of My splendor.

shloka: अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन। विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जगत्॥
translation: But what need is there, Arjuna, for all this detailed knowledge? With a single fragment of Myself, I pervade and support this entire universe.

shloka: अर्जुन उवाच। मदनुग्रहाय परमं गुह्यमध्यात्मसंज्ञितम्। यत्त्वयोक्तं वचस्तेन मोहोऽयं विगतो मम॥
translation: Arjuna said: By Your grace, You have revealed to me this supreme secret concerning the Self. Through Your words, my delusion is dispelled.

shloka: भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया। त्वत्तः कमलपत्राक्ष माहात्म्यमपि चाव्ययम्॥
translation: O lotus-eyed Krishna, I have heard from You in detail about the origin and dissolution of beings, and Your imperishable glory.

shloka: एवमेतद्यथात्थ त्वमात्मानं परमेश्वर। द्रष्टुमिच्छामि ते रूपमैश्वरं पुरुषोत्तम॥
translation: O Supreme Lord, as You have described Yourself, I wish to see Your divine cosmic form, O Purushottama.

shloka: मन्यसे यदि तच्छक्यं मया द्रष्टुमिति प्रभो। योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयात्मानमव्ययम्॥
translation: O Lord of Yoga, if You think me capable of beholding it, then reveal to me Your imperishable cosmic form.

shloka: श्रीभगवानुवाच। पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः। नानाविधानि दिव्यानि नानावर्णाकृतीनि च॥
translation: The Lord said: O Arjuna, behold My forms in hundreds and thousands—divine, manifold, and of countless colors and shapes.

shloka: पश्यादित्यान्वसून्रुद्रानश्विनौ मरुतस्तथा। बहून्यदृष्टपूर्वाणि पश्याश्चर्याणि भारत॥
translation: See the Adityas, Vasus, Rudras, Ashvins, and Maruts—many wonders never seen before, O Arjuna.

shloka: इहैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं पश्याद्य सचराचरम्। मम देहे गुडाकेश यच्चान्यद्द्रष्टुमिच्छसि॥
translation: Now behold the entire universe, moving and unmoving, centered here in My body, O Arjuna—and whatever else you desire to see.

shloka: न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा। दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षुः पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम्॥
translation: But you cannot see Me with your physical eyes. I grant you divine vision—behold My supreme Yoga power!

shloka: संजय उवाच। एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजन्महायोगेश्वरो हरिः। दर्शयामास पार्थाय परमं रूपमैश्वरम्॥
translation: Sanjaya said: O King, having spoken thus, the great Lord of Yoga, Hari, revealed to Arjuna His supreme cosmic form.

shloka: अनेकवक्त्रनयनमनेकाद्भुतदर्शनम्। अनेकदिव्याभरणं दिव्यानेकोद्यतायुधम्॥ दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरं दिव्यगन्धानुलेपनम्। सर्वाश्चर्यमयं देवमनन्तं विश्वतोमुखम्॥
translation: With countless faces and eyes, displaying endless wonders, adorned with divine ornaments and weapons, wearing heavenly garlands and garments, anointed with celestial perfumes—the infinite, all-faced, marvelous Lord of the universe.

shloka: दिवि सूर्यसहस्रस्य भवेद्युगपदुत्थिता। यदि भाः सदृशी सा स्याद्भासस्तस्य महात्मनः॥
translation: If the radiance of a thousand suns were to blaze forth at once in the sky, that might resemble the splendor of that great Being.

shloka: तत्रैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं प्रविभक्तमनेकधा। अपश्यद्देवदेवस्य शरीरे पाण्डवस्तदा॥
translation: Then Arjuna saw the entire universe, with its manifold divisions, all united in the body of the God of gods.

shloka: ततः स विस्मयाविष्टो हृष्टरोमा धनञ्जयः। प्रणम्य शिरसा देवं कृताञ्जलिरभाषत॥
translation: Then Arjuna, filled with wonder and his hair standing on end, bowed his head to the Lord and spoke with folded hands.

shloka: अर्जुन उवाच। पश्यामि देवांस्तव देव देहे सर्वांस्तथा भूतविशेषसंघान्। ब्रह्माणमीशं कमलासनस्थमृषींश्च सर्वानुरगांश्च दिव्यान्॥
translation: Arjuna said: O Lord, I see in Your body all the gods, all beings, Brahma seated on the lotus, the sages, and celestial serpents.

shloka: अनेकबाहूदरवक्त्रनेत्रं पश्यामि त्वां सर्वतोऽनन्तरूपम्। नान्तं न मध्यं न पुनस्तवादिं पश्यामि विश्वेश्वर विश्वरूप॥
translation: I see Your infinite form with countless arms, bellies, faces, and eyes—without beginning, middle, or end, O Lord of the universe, whose form is the universe itself!

shloka: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रहस्तमिच्छामि त्वां द्रष्टुमहं तथैव। तेजोराशिं सर्वतो दीप्तिमन्तं पश्यामि त्वां दुर्निरीक्ष्यं समन्ताद्दीप्तानलार्कद्युतिमप्रमेयम्॥
translation: I see You crowned, wielding mace and discus, a mass of radiance blazing everywhere, hard to behold—shining like the fire of the sun, immeasurable.

shloka: त्वमक्षरं परमं वेदितव्यं त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम्। त्वमव्ययः शाश्वतधर्मगोप्ता सनातनस्त्वं पुरुषो मतो मे॥
translation: You are the imperishable Supreme to be known, the ultimate treasure of the universe, the guardian of eternal dharma, the everlasting Person—so I deem You.

shloka: अनादिमध्यान्तमनन्तवीर्यमनन्तबाहुं शशिसूर्यनेत्रम्। पश्यामि त्वां दीप्तहुताशवक्त्रं स्वतेजसा विश्वमिदं तपन्तम्॥
translation: I see You without beginning, middle, or end, infinite in power, with countless arms, the sun and moon as Your eyes, Your mouth a blazing fire scorching the universe with Your radiance.

shloka: द्यावापृथिव्योरिदमन्तरं हि व्याप्तं त्वयैकेन दिशश्च सर्वाः। दृष्ट्वाद्भुतं रूपमुग्रं तवेदं लोकत्रयं प्रव्यथितं महात्मन्॥
translation: The space between heaven and earth and all directions are pervaded by You alone. Seeing this wondrous and terrible form of Yours, O great one, the three worlds tremble.

shloka: अमी हि त्वां सुरसंघाः विशन्ति केचिद्भीताः प्राञ्जलयो गृणन्ति। स्वस्तीत्युक्त्वा महर्षिसिद्धसंघाः स्तुवन्ति त्वां स्तुतिभिः पुष्कलाभिः॥
translation: Hosts of gods enter You; some, terrified, pray with folded hands. Great sages and perfected beings hail You with cries of 'Peace!' and sing Your glories with rich hymns.

shloka: रुद्रादित्या वसवो ये च साध्या विश्वेऽश्विनौ मरुतश्चोष्मपाश्च। गन्धर्वयक्षासुरसिद्धसंघा वीक्षन्ते त्वां विस्मिताश्चैव सर्वे॥
translation: The Rudras, Adityas, Vasus, Sadhyas, Vishvadevas, Ashvins, Maruts, ancestors, Gandharvas, Yakshas, Asuras, and Siddhas—all gaze at You in astonishment.

shloka: रूपं महत्ते बहुवक्त्रनेत्रं महाबाहो बहुबाहूरुपादम्। बहूदरं बहुदंष्ट्राकरालं दृष्ट्वा लोकाः प्रव्यथितास्तथाहम्॥
translation: O mighty-armed one, seeing Your colossal form with many mouths, eyes, arms, thighs, feet, bellies, and terrible fangs, the worlds tremble—and so do I.

shloka: नभःस्पृशं दीप्तमनेकवर्णं व्यात्ताननं दीप्तविशालनेत्रम्। दृष्ट्वा हि त्वां प्रव्यथितान्तरात्मा धृतिं न विन्दामि शमं च विष्णो॥
translation: O Vishnu, seeing Your blazing, sky-touching, multi-hued form with gaping mouths and fiery vast eyes, my heart trembles. I lose courage and peace.

shloka: दंष्ट्राकरालानि च ते मुखानि दृष्ट्वैव कालानलसन्निभानि। दिशो न जाने न लभे च शर्म प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास॥
translation: Your terrible fanged mouths, blazing like the fires of doomsday—I know not the directions, I find no refuge. Have mercy, O Lord of gods, abode of the universe!

shloka: अमी च त्वां धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्राः सर्वे सहैवावनिपालसंघैः। भीष्मो द्रोणः सूतपुत्रस्तथासौ सहास्मदीयैरपि योधमुख्यैः॥ वक्त्राणि ते त्वरमाणा विशन्ति दंष्ट्राकरालानि भयानकानि। केचिद्विलग्ना दशनान्तरेषु संदृश्यन्ते चूर्णितैरुत्तमाङ्गैः॥
translation: All the sons of Dhritarashtra, with hosts of kings, Bhishma, Drona, Karna, and our own warriors rush into Your fearful, fanged mouths. Some are seen crushed between Your teeth, their heads ground to powder.

shloka: यथा नदीनां बहवोऽम्बुवेगाः समुद्रमेवाभिमुखा द्रवन्ति। तथा तवामी नरलोकवीरा विशन्ति वक्त्राण्यभिविज्वलन्ति॥
translation: As rivers rush toward the ocean, so these heroes of the human world enter Your flaming mouths.

shloka: यथा प्रदीप्तं ज्वलनं पतङ्गा विशन्ति नाशाय समृद्धवेगाः। तथैव नाशाय विशन्ति लोकास्तवापि वक्त्राणि समृद्धवेगाः॥
translation: As moths rush into a blazing fire to perish, so these men rush into Your mouths with speed to meet their destruction.

shloka: लेलिह्यसे ग्रसमानः समन्ताल्लोकान्समग्रान्वदनैर्ज्वलद्भिः। तेजोभिरापूर्य जगत्समग्रं भासस्तवोग्राः प्रतपन्ति विष्णो॥
translation: O Vishnu, You lick all worlds with Your flaming mouths, devouring them entirely. Your fierce radiance fills the universe, scorching it with terrible heat.

shloka: आख्याहि मे को भवानुग्ररूपो नमोऽस्तु ते देववर प्रसीद। विज्ञातुमिच्छामि भवन्तमाद्यं न हि प्रजानामि तव प्रवृत्तिम्॥
translation: Tell me who You are, so fearsome in form. I bow to You, O supreme God—have mercy! I wish to understand You, the primal One, for I do not comprehend Your purpose.

shloka: श्रीभगवानुवाच। कालोऽस्मि लोकक्षयकृत्प्रवृद्धो लोकान्समाहर्तुमिह प्रवृत्तः। ऋतेऽपि त्वां न भविष्यन्ति सर्वे येऽवस्थिताः प्रत्यनीकेषु योधाः॥
translation: The Lord said: I am mighty Time, the destroyer of worlds, here to annihilate all. Even without you, these warriors arrayed in opposing armies shall cease to exist.

shloka: तस्मात्त्वमुत्तिष्ठ यशो लभस्व जित्वा शत्रून्भुङ्क्ष्व राज्यं समृद्धम्। मयैवैते निहताः पूर्वमेव निमित्तमात्रं भव सव्यसाचिन्॥
translation: Therefore, arise and fight! Gain glory, conquer your foes, and enjoy a prosperous kingdom. By Me alone have they already been slain. Be merely the instrument, O Arjuna.

shloka: द्रोणं च भीष्मं च जयद्रथं च कर्णं तथान्यानपि योधवीरान्। मया हतांस्त्वं जहि मा व्यथिष्ठा युध्यस्व जेतासि रणे सपत्नान्॥
translation: Slay Drona, Bhishma, Jayadratha, Karna, and other great warriors already doomed by Me. Do not hesitate—fight! You shall triumph over your enemies.

shloka: संजय उवाच। एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं केशवस्य कृताञ्जलिर्वेपमानः किरीटी। नमस्कृत्वा भूय एवाह कृष्णं सगद्गदं भीतभीतः प्रणम्य॥
translation: Sanjaya said: Hearing Krishna’s words, Arjuna, trembling and humbled, bowed low with folded hands. Overcome with fear, he spoke to Krishna in a choked voice.

shloka: अर्जुन उवाच। स्थाने हृषीकेश तव प्रकीर्त्या जगत्प्रहृष्यत्यनुरज्यते च। रक्षांसि भीतानि दिशो द्रवन्ति सर्वे नमस्यन्ति च सिद्धसंघाः॥
translation: Arjuna said: O Hrishikesha, rightly do the worlds rejoice in Your glory, the demons flee in terror, and the hosts of sages bow in homage.

shloka: कस्माच्च ते न नमेरन्महात्मन् गरीयसे ब्रह्मणोऽप्यादिकर्त्रे। अनन्त देवेश जगन्निवास त्वमक्षरं सदसत्तत्परं यत्॥
translation: Why should they not bow to You, O infinite Lord, greater than Brahma, the primal Creator? O abode of the universe, You are the imperishable, the existent, the non-existent, and beyond.

shloka: त्वमादिदेवः पुरुषः पुराणस्त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम्। वेत्तासि वेद्यं च परं च धाम त्वया ततं विश्वमनन्तरूप॥
translation: You are the primal God, the ancient Person, the supreme refuge of this universe. You are the knower, the known, and the supreme abode. By You is all this pervaded, O infinite One!

shloka: वायुर्यमोऽग्निर्वरुणः शशाङ्कः प्रजापतिस्त्वं प्रपितामहश्च। नमो नमस्तेऽस्तु सहस्रकृत्वः पुनश्च भूयोऽपि नमो नमस्ते॥
translation: You are Vayu, Yama, Agni, Varuna, the moon, Prajapati, and the great-grandfather. Salutations to You a thousand times! Again and again salutations to You!

shloka: नमः पुरस्तादथ पृष्ठतस्ते नमोऽस्तु ते सर्वत एव सर्व। अनन्तवीर्यामितविक्रमस्त्वं सर्वं समाप्नोषि ततोऽसि सर्वः॥
translation: Salutations to You from front and back! Salutations from all sides, O All! Infinite in power, boundless in might, You pervade all; therefore You are all.

shloka: सखेति मत्वा प्रसभं यदुक्तं हे कृष्ण हे यादव हे सखेति। अजानता महिमानं तवेदं मया प्रमादात्प्रणयेन वापि॥ यच्चावहासार्थमसत्कृतोऽसि विहारशय्यासनभोजनेषु। एकोऽथवाप्यच्युत तत्समक्षं तत्क्षामये त्वामहमप्रमेयम्॥
translation: Thinking of You as my friend, I rashly called out, 'O Krishna! O Yadava! O friend!'—not knowing Your majesty. In jest or carelessness, in play, rest, sitting, or eating, alone or before others, I dishonored You. Forgive me, O immeasurable One!

shloka: पितासि लोकस्य चराचरस्य त्वमस्य पूज्यश्च गुरुर्गरीयान्। न त्वत्समोऽस्त्यभ्यधिकः कुतोऽन्यो लोकत्रयेऽप्यप्रतिमप्रभाव॥
translation: You are the father of all moving and unmoving beings, their worshipful master and supreme teacher. None equal You—how could there be one greater? O unrivaled Lord, Your power is incomparable in all the worlds.

shloka: तस्मात्प्रणम्य प्रणिधाय कायं प्रसादये त्वामहमीशमीड्यम्। पितेव पुत्रस्य सखेव सख्युः प्रियः प्रियायार्हसि देव सोढुम्॥
translation: Therefore, bowing low and prostrating my body, I seek Your grace, O adorable Lord! As a father tolerates his son, a friend his friend, a lover his beloved—so should You bear with me, O God.

shloka: अदृष्टपूर्वं हृषितोऽस्मि दृष्ट्वा भयेन च प्रव्यथितं मनो मे। तदेव मे दर्शय देव रूपं प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास॥
translation: Having seen what was never seen before, I am thrilled, yet my mind trembles with fear. Show me again Your gentle form, O Lord of gods, abode of the universe!

shloka: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रहस्तमिच्छामि त्वां द्रष्टुमहं तथैव। तेनैव रूपेण चतुर्भुजेन सहस्रबाहो भव विश्वमूर्ते॥
translation: I wish to see You as before—crowned, wielding mace and discus, in Your four-armed form, O thousand-armed, universal Being!

shloka: श्रीभगवानुवाच। मया प्रसन्नेन तवार्जुनेदं रूपं परं दर्शितमात्मयोगात्। दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षुः पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम्॥
translation: The Lord said: Out of grace, I have shown you this supreme cosmic form by My own power—never seen before. Now behold again My gentle form, as you desire.

shloka: संजय उवाच। एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजन्महायोगेश्वरो हरिः। दर्शयामास पार्थाय परमं रूपमैश्वरम्॥
translation: Sanjaya said: Having spoken thus, the great Lord of Yoga, Hari, revealed again His gentle form to Arjuna.

shloka: भूय एव महातेजा रूपमेतत्परं दर्शयामास वासुदेवः। आश्वासयामास च भीतमेनं भूत्वा पुनः सौम्यवपुर्महात्मा॥
translation: The resplendent Vasudeva, assuming His gentle and beautiful form, consoled the terrified Arjuna.

shloka: अर्जुन उवाच। दृष्ट्वेदं मानुषं रूपं तव सौम्यं जनार्दन। इदानीमस्मि संवृत्तः सचेताः प्रकृतिं गतः॥
translation: Arjuna said: O Janardana, seeing this gentle human form of Yours, my mind is now composed, and I am restored to my nature.

shloka: श्रीभगवानुवाच। सुदुर्दर्शमिदं रूपं दृष्टवानसि यन्मम। देवा अप्यस्य रूपस्य नित्यं दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः॥
translation: The Lord said: This form of Mine you have seen is exceedingly difficult to behold. Even the gods ever long to see it.

shloka: नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानेन न चेज्यया। शक्य एवंविधो द्रष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा॥
translation: Not by the Vedas, austerities, charity, or rituals can I be seen as you have seen Me.

shloka: भक्त्या त्वनन्यया शक्य अहमेवंविधोऽर्जुन। ज्ञातुं द्रष्टुं च तत्त्वेन प्रवेष्टुं च परन्तप॥
translation: O Arjuna, only by unwavering devotion can I be known in truth, seen as I am, and entered into.

shloka: मत्कर्मकृन्मत्परमो मद्भक्तः सङ्गवर्जितः। निर्वैरः सर्वभूतेषु यः स मामेति पाण्डव॥
translation: O Arjuna, one who works for Me, who makes Me the supreme goal, who is devoted to Me, free from attachment and hostility toward all beings—such a one comes to Me.

shloka: इति गुह्यतमं शास्त्रमिदमुक्तं मयानघ। एतद्बुद्ध्वा बुद्धिमान्स्यात्कृतकृत्यश्च भारत॥
translation: Thus, O sinless one, I have declared to you this most secret knowledge. Understanding this, one becomes wise and fulfills all duties, O Arjuna.

shloka: भगवानुवाच। भक्त्या मामभिजानाति यावान्यश्चास्मि तत्त्वतः। ततो मां तत्त्वतो ज्ञात्वा विशते तदनन्तरम्॥
translation: The Lord said: By devotion one comes to know Me in truth—who and what I am. Then, knowing Me thus, they enter into Me without delay.

shloka: मत्कर्मकृन्मत्परमो मद्भक्तः सङ्गवर्जितः। निर्वैरः सर्वभूतेषु यः स मामेति पाण्डव॥
translation: O Arjuna, one who works for Me, who makes Me the supreme goal, who is devoted to Me, free from attachment and hostility toward all beings—such a one comes to Me.

shloka: मत्कर्मकृन्मत्परमो मद्भक्तः सङ्गवर्जितः। निर्वैरः सर्वभूतेषु यः स मामेति पाण्डव॥
translation: O Arjuna, one who works for Me, who makes Me the supreme goal, who is devoted to Me, free from attachment and hostility toward all beings—such a one comes to Me.

shloka: अर्जुन उवाच। एवं सततयुक्ता ये भक्तास्त्वां पर्युपासते। ये चाप्यक्षरमव्यक्तं तेषां के योगवित्तमाः॥
translation: Arjuna said: Those devotees who, ever steadfast, worship You (personal form), and those who worship the imperishable, unmanifest—which of them are better versed in Yoga?

shloka: श्रीभगवानुवाच। मय्यावेश्य मनो ये मां नित्ययुक्ता उपासते। श्रद्धया परयोपेतास्ते मे युक्ततमा मताः॥
translation: The Lord said: Those who fix their minds on Me and worship Me with steadfast faith, I consider them most perfect in Yoga.

shloka: ये त्वक्षरमनिर्देश्यमव्यक्तं पर्युपासते। सर्वत्रगमचिन्त्यं च कूटस्थमचलं ध्रुवम्॥
translation: But those who worship the imperishable, indefinable, unmanifest, omnipresent, inconceivable, unchanging, and immovable (formless Brahman)—

shloka: संनियम्येन्द्रियग्रामं सर्वत्र समबुद्धयः। ते प्राप्नुवन्ति मामेव सर्वभूतहिते रताः॥
translation: Restraining all senses, even-minded everywhere, rejoicing in the welfare of all beings—they too attain Me.

shloka: क्लेशोऽधिकतरस्तेषामव्यक्तासक्तचेतसाम्। अव्यक्ता हि गतिर्दुःखं देहवद्भिरवाप्यते॥
translation: Greater is the struggle for those whose minds are attached to the unmanifest, for the path of the formless is hard for embodied beings to attain.

shloka: ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्पराः। अनन्येनैव योगेन मां ध्यायन्त उपासते॥
translation: But those who surrender all actions to Me, intent on Me, worship Me with single-minded devotion—

shloka: तेषामहं समुद्धर्ता मृत्युसंसारसागरात्। भवामि नचिरात्पार्थ मय्यावेशितचेतसाम्॥
translation: I swiftly rescue them from the ocean of birth and death, O Arjuna, for their minds are absorbed in Me.

shloka: मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय। निवसिष्यसि मय्येव अत ऊर्ध्वं न संशयः॥
translation: Fix your mind on Me alone, surrender your intellect to Me. Thereupon, you shall dwell in Me forever—of this, there is no doubt.

shloka: अथ चित्तं समाधातुं न शक्नोषि मयि स्थिरम्। अभ्यासयोगेन ततो मामिच्छाप्तुं धनञ्जय॥
translation: If you cannot fix your mind steadily on Me, then seek to reach Me by repeated practice (Abhyasa Yoga), O Arjuna.

shloka: अभ्यासेऽप्यसमर्थोऽसि मत्कर्मपरमो भव। मदर्थमपि कर्माणि कुर्वन्सिद्धिमवाप्स्यसि॥
translation: If even practice is beyond you, be intent on acting for My sake. By performing actions for Me, you shall attain perfection.

shloka: अथैतदप्यशक्तोऽसि कर्तुं मद्योगमाश्रितः। सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं ततः कुरु यतात्मवान्॥
translation: If you cannot do even this, then take refuge in Me, renouncing the fruits of all actions, with self-discipline.

shloka: श्रेयो हि ज्ञानमभ्यासाज्ज्ञानाद्ध्यानं विशिष्यते। ध्यानात्कर्मफलत्यागस्त्यागाच्छान्तिरनन्तरम्॥
translation: Knowledge is better than practice, meditation is better than knowledge, renunciation of the fruits of action is better than meditation—peace immediately follows renunciation.

shloka: अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च। निर्ममो निरहंकारः समदुःखसुखः क्षमी॥
translation: He who hates no being, is friendly and compassionate, free from possessiveness and ego, even-minded in pain and pleasure, forgiving—

shloka: संतुष्टः सततं योगी यतात्मा दृढनिश्चयः। मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः॥
translation: Ever content, self-controlled, firm in resolve, with mind and intellect surrendered to Me—such a devotee is dear to Me.

shloka: यस्मान्नोद्विजते लोको लोकान्नोद्विजते च यः। हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो यः स च मे प्रियः॥
translation: He by whom the world is not agitated and who is not agitated by the world, free from joy, envy, fear, and anxiety—he is dear to Me.

shloka: अनपेक्षः शुचिर्दक्ष उदासीनो गतव्यथः। सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः॥
translation: He who is free from expectations, pure, skilled, indifferent, untroubled, and renounces all undertakings—such a devotee is dear to Me.

shloka: यो न हृष्यति न द्वेष्टि न शोचति न काङ्क्षति। शुभाशुभपरित्यागी भक्तिमान्यः स मे प्रियः॥
translation: He who neither rejoices nor hates, neither grieves nor desires, renouncing good and evil—such a devotee is dear to Me.

shloka: समः शत्रौ च मित्रे च तथा मानापमानयोः। शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु समः सङ्गविवर्जितः॥
translation: He who is equal to friend and foe, honor and dishonor, cold and heat, pleasure and pain, free from attachment—

shloka: तुल्यनिन्दास्तुतिर्मौनी सन्तुष्टो येन केनचित्। अनिकेतः स्थिरमतिर्भक्तिमान्मे प्रियो नरः॥
translation: Silent, content with anything, homeless, steady-minded, full of devotion—such a man is dear to Me.

shloka: ये तु धर्म्यामृतमिदं यथोक्तं पर्युपासते। श्रद्दधाना मत्परमा भक्तास्तेऽतीव मे प्रियाः॥
translation: But those who cherish this immortal Dharma (path of devotion) as declared above, full of faith, with Me as their supreme goal—they are exceedingly dear to Me.

shloka: अर्जुन उवाच। प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव क्षेत्रं क्षेत्रज्ञमेव च। एतद्वेदितुमिच्छामि ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं च केशव॥
translation: Arjuna said: O Kesava, I wish to understand what are the field (kshetra) and the knower of the field (kshetrajna), what is knowledge and what is the object of knowledge.

shloka: श्रीभगवानुवाच। इदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते। एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहुः क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तद्विदः॥
translation: The Lord said: O Arjuna, this body is called the field (kshetra), and the one who knows this body is called the knower of the field (kshetrajna) by the wise.

shloka: क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत। क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं मतं मम॥
translation: O Arjuna, know Me to be the knower of all fields. The knowledge of the field and the knower of the field is true wisdom, according to Me.

shloka: तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक्च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत्। स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे शृणु॥
translation: What the field is, its nature, its modifications, its source, and also who the knower is and what his powers are—hear all this from Me in brief.

shloka: ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधैः पृथक्। ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भिर्विनिश्चितैः॥
translation: This has been sung by sages in various ways, in different Vedic hymns, and also in the conclusive and reasoned words of the Brahma Sutras.

shloka: महाभूतान्यहंकारो बुद्धिरव्यक्तमेव च। इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च पञ्च चेन्द्रियगोचराः॥ इच्छा द्वेषः सुखं दुःखं संघातश्चेतना धृतिः। एतत्क्षेत्रं समासेन सविकारमुदाहृतम्॥
translation: The great elements, ego, intellect, the unmanifest, the ten senses, the mind, and the five sense objects; desire, hatred, pleasure, pain, the aggregate, consciousness, and fortitude—this, in brief, is the field with its modifications.

shloka: अमानित्वमदम्भित्वमहिंसा क्षान्तिरार्जवम्। आचार्योपासनं शौचं स्थैर्यमात्मविनिग्रहः॥
translation: Humility, unpretentiousness, non-violence, forgiveness, uprightness, service to the teacher, purity, steadfastness, self-control—

shloka: इन्द्रियार्थेषु वैराग्यमनहंकार एव च। जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिदुःखदोषानुदर्शनम्॥
translation: Dispassion toward sense objects, absence of ego, and perception of the evils of birth, death, old age, and disease—

shloka: असक्तिरनभिष्वङ्गः पुत्रदारगृहादिषु। नित्यं च समचित्तत्वमिष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु॥
translation: Non-attachment, absence of clinging to son, wife, home, and the like, and constant equanimity in the attainment of the desirable and undesirable—

shloka: मयि चानन्ययोगेन भक्तिरव्यभिचारिणी। विविक्तदेशसेवित्वमरतिर्जनसंसदि॥
translation: Unswerving devotion to Me through exclusive yoga, resorting to solitary places, and avoidance of crowds—

shloka: अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यत्वं तत्त्वज्ञानार्थदर्शनम्। एतज्ज्ञानमिति प्रोक्तमज्ञानं यदतोऽन्यथा॥
translation: Constancy in spiritual knowledge, perception of the goal of true knowledge—this is declared to be knowledge, and what is contrary to this is ignorance.

shloka: ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वामृतमश्नुते। अनादि मत्परं ब्रह्म न सत्तन्नासदुच्यते॥
translation: I shall now explain the knowable, knowing which one attains immortality. The supreme Brahman is beginningless; it is said to be neither existent nor non-existent.

shloka: सर्वतः पाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम्। सर्वतः श्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति॥
translation: With hands and feet everywhere, with eyes, heads, and mouths everywhere, with ears everywhere, He exists in the world, enveloping all.

shloka: सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम्। असक्तं सर्वभृच्चैव निर्गुणं गुणभोक्तृ च॥
translation: Shining by the functions of all the senses, yet without the senses; unattached, yet supporting all; devoid of qualities, yet their experiencer—

shloka: बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च। सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके च तत्॥
translation: He is within and without all beings, animate and inanimate; He is incomprehensible because of His subtlety; He is far away, yet very near.

shloka: अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम्। भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च॥
translation: Undivided, yet appearing as divided in beings; He is the sustainer of all beings, the knowable; He devours and generates.

shloka: ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमसः परमुच्यते। ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम्॥
translation: The light of all lights, beyond darkness; He is knowledge, the object of knowledge, and the goal of knowledge, seated in the hearts of all.

shloka: इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासतः। मद्भक्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भावायोपपद्यते॥
translation: Thus, the field, knowledge, and the knowable have been briefly described. My devotee, understanding this, becomes worthy of My state.

shloka: प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि। विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसंभवान्॥
translation: Know both Prakriti (nature) and Purusha (soul) to be beginningless. Know also that all modifications and qualities are born of Prakriti.

shloka: कार्यकरणकर्तृत्वे हेतुः प्रकृतिरुच्यते। पुरुषः सुखदुःखानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते॥
translation: Prakriti is said to be the cause of the body, senses, and their functions. Purusha is said to be the cause of experiencing pleasure and pain.

shloka: पुरुषः प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङ्क्ते प्रकृतिजान्गुणान्। कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु॥
translation: The Purusha, seated in Prakriti, experiences the qualities born of Prakriti. Attachment to the qualities is the cause of his birth in good and evil wombs.

shloka: उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वरः। परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुषः परः॥
translation: The Supreme Purusha in this body is called the Witness, Permitter, Supporter, Experiencer, the Great Lord, and the Supreme Self.

shloka: य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणैः सह। सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते॥
translation: He who thus knows Purusha and Prakriti with its qualities, though ever active, is not born again.

shloka: ध्यानेनात्मनि पश्यन्ति केचिदात्मानमात्मना। अन्ये सांख्येन योगेन कर्मयोगेन चापरे॥
translation: Some perceive the Self in the self through meditation, others through philosophical discernment, and others through selfless action.

shloka: अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्तः श्रुत्वान्येभ्य उपासते। तेऽपि चातितरन्त्येव मृत्युं श्रुतिपरायणाः॥
translation: Others, not knowing thus, worship through hearing from others. They too transcend death by their devotion to what they have heard.

shloka: यावत्सञ्जायते किञ्चित्सत्त्वं स्थावरजङ्गमम्। क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञसंयोगात्तद्विद्धि भरतर्षभ॥
translation: O Arjuna, whatever being is born—moving or unmoving—know it to arise from the union of the field and the knower of the field.

shloka: समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम्। विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं यः पश्यति स पश्यति॥
translation: He who sees the Supreme Lord, existing equally in all beings, the imperishable amidst the perishable—he truly sees.

shloka: समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम्। न हिनस्त्यात्मनात्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम्॥
translation: Seeing the Lord equally present everywhere, he does not degrade himself by his mind, and thus attains the supreme goal.

shloka: प्रकृत्यैव च कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि सर्वशः। यः पश्यति तथात्मानमकर्तारं स पश्यति॥
translation: He who sees that all actions are performed by Prakriti alone, and that the Self is actionless—he truly sees.

shloka: यदा भूतपृथग्भावमेकस्थमनुपश्यति। तत एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म संपद्यते तदा॥
translation: When he perceives the diverse existence of beings as rooted in the One and their expansion from It alone—then he attains Brahman.

shloka: अनादित्वान्निर्गुणत्वात्परमात्मायमव्ययः। शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते॥
translation: O Arjuna, the Supreme Self, being beginningless and devoid of qualities, though dwelling in the body, neither acts nor is tainted.

shloka: यथा सर्वगतं सौक्ष्म्यादाकाशं नोपलिप्यते। सर्वत्रावस्थितो देहे तथात्मा नोपलिप्यते॥
translation: As the all-pervading space is not tainted because of its subtlety, so the Self, though present in the body, is never tainted.

shloka: यथा प्रकाशयत्येकः कृत्स्नं लोकमिमं रविः। क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्नं प्रकाशयति भारत॥
translation: O Arjuna, as the sun alone illumines this entire world, so the knower of the field illumines the entire field.

shloka: क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवमन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा। भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम्॥
translation: Those who perceive with the eye of wisdom the distinction between the field and its knower, and the liberation of beings from Prakriti—they attain the Supreme.

shloka: श्रीभगवानुवाच। परं भूयः प्रवक्ष्यामि ज्ञानानां ज्ञानमुत्तमम्। यज्ज्ञात्वा मुनयः सर्वे परां सिद्धिमितो गताः॥
translation: The Lord said: I shall again declare the supreme wisdom, the best of all knowledge, by knowing which all the sages have attained the highest perfection.

shloka: इदं ज्ञानमुपाश्रित्य मम साधर्म्यमागताः। सर्गेऽपि नोपजायन्ते प्रलये न व्यथन्ति च॥
translation: Those who take refuge in this wisdom attain My divine nature. Even at the time of creation, they are not born, nor are they disturbed at the time of dissolution.

shloka: मम योनिर्महद्ब्रह्म तस्मिन्गर्भं दधाम्यहम्। संभवः सर्वभूतानां ततो भवति भारत॥
translation: My womb is the great Brahman; in that I place the seed. From this, O Arjuna, comes the birth of all beings.

shloka: सर्वयोनिषु कौन्तेय मूर्तयः संभवन्ति याः। तासां ब्रह्म महद्योनिरहं बीजप्रदः पिता॥
translation: Whatever forms are produced in all wombs, O Arjuna, the great Brahman is their womb, and I am the seed-giving father.

shloka: सत्त्वं रजस्तम इति गुणाः प्रकृतिसंभवाः। निबध्नन्ति महाबाहो देहे देहिनमव्ययम्॥
translation: Sattva (goodness), Rajas (passion), and Tamas (ignorance)—these three gunas born of Prakriti bind the imperishable soul to the body, O mighty-armed Arjuna.

shloka: तत्र सत्त्वं निर्मलत्वात्प्रकाशकमनामयम्। सुखसङ्गेन बध्नाति ज्ञानसङ्गेन चानघ॥
translation: Of these, Sattva, being pure, is luminous and free from sin. It binds by attachment to happiness and knowledge, O sinless one.

shloka: रजो रागात्मकं विद्धि तृष्णासङ्गसमुद्भवम्। निबध्नाति कौन्तेय कर्मसङ्गेन देहिनम्॥
translation: Know Rajas to be of the nature of passion, arising from craving and attachment. It binds the soul, O Arjuna, through attachment to action.

shloka: तमस्त्वज्ञानजं विद्धि मोहनं सर्वदेहिनाम्। प्रमादालस्यनिद्राभिस्तन्निबध्नाति भारत॥
translation: Know Tamas to be born of ignorance, deluding all beings. It binds them, O Arjuna, through negligence, laziness, and sleep.

shloka: सत्त्वं सुखे संजयति रजः कर्मणि भारत। ज्ञानमावृत्य तु तमः प्रमादे संजयत्युत॥
translation: Sattva binds one to happiness, Rajas to action, and Tamas, obscuring knowledge, binds one to negligence.

shloka: रजस्तमश्चाभिभूय सत्त्वं भवति भारत। रजः सत्त्वं तमश्चैव तमः सत्त्वं रजस्तथा॥
translation: Sometimes Sattva prevails over Rajas and Tamas, O Arjuna, sometimes Rajas over Sattva and Tamas, and sometimes Tamas over Sattva and Rajas.

shloka: सर्वद्वारेषु देहेऽस्मिन्प्रकाश उपजायते। ज्ञानं यदा तदा विद्याद्विवृद्धं सत्त्वमित्युत॥
translation: When the light of knowledge shines through all the gates of the body, then it may be known that Sattva is increasing.

shloka: लोभः प्रवृत्तिरारम्भः कर्मणामशमः स्पृहा। राजस्येष्टानि वृत्तानि यदा वर्धन्ति भारत॥
translation: Greed, activity, the undertaking of actions, restlessness, and craving—these arise when Rajas is predominant, O Arjuna.

shloka: अप्रकाशोऽप्रवृत्तिश्च प्रमादो मोह एव च। तामस्येष्टानि वृत्तानि यदा वर्धन्ति भारत॥
translation: Darkness, inertia, negligence, and delusion—these arise when Tamas is predominant, O Arjuna.

shloka: यदा सत्त्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत्। तदोत्तमविदां लोकानमलान्प्रतिपद्यते॥
translation: If one dies when Sattva is predominant, one attains the pure worlds of the knowers of the Highest.

shloka: रजसि प्रलयं गत्वा कर्मसङ्गिषु जायते। तथा प्रलीनस्तमसि मूढयोनिषु जायते॥
translation: If one dies when Rajas is predominant, one is born among those attached to action. If one dies when Tamas is predominant, one is born in the wombs of the deluded.

shloka: कर्मणः सुकृतस्याहुः सात्त्विकं निर्मलं फलम्। रजसस्तु फलं दुःखमज्ञानं तमसः फलम्॥
translation: The fruit of good action is said to be Sattvic and pure, the fruit of Rajas is suffering, and the fruit of Tamas is ignorance.

shloka: सत्त्वात्संजायते ज्ञानं रजसो लोभ एव च। प्रमादमोहौ तमसो भवतोऽज्ञानमेव च॥
translation: From Sattva arises wisdom, from Rajas arises greed, and from Tamas arise negligence, delusion, and ignorance.

shloka: ऊर्ध्वं गच्छन्ति सत्त्वस्था मध्ये तिष्ठन्ति राजसाः। जघन्यगुणवृत्तिस्था अधो गच्छन्ति तामसाः॥
translation: Those established in Sattva rise upward, those in Rajas remain in the middle, and those in Tamas, abiding in the lowest quality, sink downward.

shloka: नान्यं गुणेभ्यः कर्तारं यदा द्रष्टानुपश्यति। गुणेभ्यश्च परं वेत्ति मद्भावं सोऽधिगच्छति॥
translation: When the seer beholds no agent other than the gunas and knows That which is beyond the gunas, he attains My nature.

shloka: गुणानेतानतीत्य त्रीन्देही देहसमुद्भवान्। जन्ममृत्युजरादुःखैर्विमुक्तोऽमृतमश्नुते॥
translation: When the embodied soul rises above the three gunas originating from the body, it is freed from birth, death, old age, and sorrow, and attains immortality.

shloka: अर्जुन उवाच। कैर्लिङ्गैस्त्रीन्गुणानेतानतीतो भवति प्रभो। किमाचारः कथं चैतांस्त्रीन्गुणानतिवर्तते॥
translation: Arjuna said: By what signs is one known who has transcended the three gunas, O Lord? What is his conduct, and how does he rise above the gunas?

shloka: श्रीभगवानुवाच। प्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव। न द्वेष्टि संप्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ्क्षति॥
translation: The Lord said: O Arjuna, he who does not hate illumination (Sattva), activity (Rajas), or delusion (Tamas) when they arise, nor longs for them when they cease.

shloka: उदासीनवदासीनो गुणैर्यो न विचाल्यते। गुणा वर्तन्त इत्येव योऽवतिष्ठति नेङ्गते॥
translation: He who, seated like a neutral, is not disturbed by the gunas, who remains firm, knowing that the gunas alone are acting.

shloka: समदुःखसुखः स्वस्थः समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः। तुल्यप्रियाप्रियो धीरस्तुल्यनिन्दात्मसंस्तुतिः॥
translation: He who is alike in pleasure and pain, self-contained, to whom a clod of earth, a stone, and gold are the same, who is balanced in blame and praise.

shloka: मानापमानयोस्तुल्यस्तुल्यो मित्रारिपक्षयोः। सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी गुणातीतः स उच्यते॥
translation: He who is the same in honor and dishonor, who treats friend and foe alike, who has abandoned all initiative for action—he is said to have transcended the gunas.

shloka: मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते। स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान्ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते॥
translation: He who serves Me with unwavering devotion, transcending the gunas, becomes fit to attain Brahman.

shloka: ब्रह्मणो हि प्रतिष्ठाहममृतस्याव्ययस्य च। शाश्वतस्य च धर्मस्य सुखस्यैकान्तिकस्य च॥
translation: For I am the abode of Brahman, the immortal and imperishable, of eternal Dharma, and of absolute bliss.

shloka: श्रीभगवानुवाच। ऊर्ध्वमूलमधःशाखमश्वत्थं प्राहुरव्ययम्। छन्दांसि यस्य पर्णानि यस्तं वेद स वेदवित्॥
translation: The Lord said: They speak of an eternal Ashvattha tree with roots above and branches below, whose leaves are the Vedic hymns. One who knows this tree knows the Vedas.

shloka: अधश्चोर्ध्वं प्रसृतास्तस्य शाखा गुणप्रवृद्धा विषयप्रवालाः। अधश्च मूलान्यनुसन्ततानि कर्मानुबन्धीनि मनुष्यलोके॥
translation: Its branches extend above and below, nourished by the gunas, with sense-objects as twigs. Below in the human world, its roots stretch forth, binding through actions.

shloka: न रूपमस्येह तथोपलभ्यते नान्तो न चादिर्न च सम्प्रतिष्ठा। अश्वत्थमेनं सुविरूढमूलमसङ्गशस्त्रेण दृढेन छित्त्वा॥
translation: Its true form is not perceived here, nor its end, nor its beginning, nor its foundation. Having cut down this firmly rooted Ashvattha tree with the strong axe of detachment,

shloka: ततः पदं तत्परिमार्गितव्यं यस्मिन्गता न निवर्तन्ति भूयः। तमेव चाद्यं पुरुषं प्रपद्ये यतः प्रवृत्तिः प्रसृता पुराणी॥
translation: One must seek that abode from which, having gone, none return. I take refuge in that Primeval Purusha, from whom this ancient activity streams forth.

shloka: निर्मानमोहा जितसङ्गदोषा अध्यात्मनित्या विनिवृत्तकामाः। द्वन्द्वैर्विमुक्ताः सुखदुःखसंज्ञैर्गच्छन्त्यमूढाः पदमव्ययं तत्॥
translation: Free from pride and delusion, victorious over the evil of attachment, ever devoted to the Self, liberated from desires, released from dualities of pleasure and pain, the undeluded reach that eternal goal.

shloka: न तद्भासयते सूर्यो न शशाङ्को न पावकः। यद्गत्वा न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम॥
translation: That abode of Mine is not illumined by the sun or moon, nor by fire. Having gone there, they do not return—that is My supreme abode.

shloka: ममैवांशो जीवलोके जीवभूतः सनातनः। मनःषष्ठानीन्द्रियाणि प्रकृतिस्थानि कर्षति॥
translation: The eternal fragment of Myself, becoming the living soul in the world of life, draws to itself the mind and the five senses, which abide in Prakriti.

shloka: शरीरं यदवाप्नोति यच्चाप्युत्क्रामतीश्वरः। गृहीत्वैतानि संयाति वायुर्गन्धानिवाशयात्॥
translation: When the Lord acquires a body and when He leaves it, He carries these senses with Him, as the wind carries fragrances from their source.

shloka: श्रोत्रं चक्षुः स्पर्शनं च रसनं घ्राणमेव च। अधिष्ठाय मनश्चायं विषयानुपसेवते॥
translation: Presiding over the ear, the eye, touch, taste, and smell, as well as the mind, He experiences the objects of the senses.

shloka: उत्क्रामन्तं स्थितं वापि भुञ्जानं वा गुणान्वितम्। विमूढा नानुपश्यन्ति पश्यन्ति ज्ञानचक्षुषः॥
translation: The deluded do not perceive Him who departs, stays, or enjoys, united with the gunas. But those with the eye of wisdom see.

shloka: यतन्तो योगिनश्चैनं पश्यन्त्यात्मन्यवस्थितम्। यतन्तोऽप्यकृतात्मानो नैनं पश्यन्त्यचेतसः॥
translation: The striving yogis see Him established in themselves, but the unrefined, though striving, do not perceive Him, due to lack of discernment.

shloka: यदादित्यगतं तेजो जगद्भासयतेऽखिलम्। यच्चन्द्रमसि यच्चाग्नौ तत्तेजो विद्धि मामकम्॥
translation: The splendor that resides in the sun, illuminating the whole world, and that which is in the moon and fire—know that splendor to be Mine.

shloka: गामाविश्य च भूतानि धारयाम्यहमोजसा। पुष्णामि चौषधीः सर्वाः सोमो भूत्वा रसात्मकः॥
translation: Entering the earth, I sustain all beings by My energy. Becoming the moon, I nourish all plants with their sap.

shloka: अहं वैश्वानरो भूत्वा प्राणिनां देहमाश्रितः। प्राणापानसमायुक्तः पचाम्यन्नं चतुर्विधम्॥
translation: Becoming the fire of digestion, I reside in the bodies of all living beings. Uniting with the incoming and outgoing breaths, I digest the four kinds of food.

shloka: सर्वस्य चाहं हृदि सन्निविष्टो मत्तः स्मृतिर्ज्ञानमपोहनं च। वेदैश्च सर्वैरहमेव वेद्यो वेदान्तकृद्वेदविदेव चाहम्॥
translation: I am seated in the hearts of all. From Me come memory, knowledge, and reasoning. I alone am to be known by all the Vedas; I am the author of Vedanta and the knower of the Vedas.

shloka: द्वाविमौ पुरुषौ लोके क्षरश्चाक्षर एव च। क्षरः सर्वाणि भूतानि कूटस्थोऽक्षर उच्यते॥
translation: There are two Purushas in this world—the perishable and the imperishable. All beings are perishable, but the unchanging is called imperishable.

shloka: उत्तमः पुरुषस्त्वन्यः परमात्मेत्युदाहृतः। यो लोकत्रयमाविश्य बिभर्त्यव्यय ईश्वरः॥
translation: But distinct is the Supreme Purusha, called the Highest Self, the indestructible Lord who, pervading the three worlds, sustains them.

shloka: यस्मात्क्षरमतीतोऽहमक्षरादपि चोत्तमः। अतोऽस्मि लोके वेदे च प्रथितः पुरुषोत्तमः॥
translation: Because I transcend the perishable and am even higher than the imperishable, I am celebrated in the world and in the Vedas as the Supreme Purusha.

shloka: यो मामेवमसंमूढो जानाति पुरुषोत्तमम्। स सर्वविद्भजति मां सर्वभावेन भारत॥
translation: He who, undeluded, knows Me thus as the Supreme Purusha, knows all, O Arjuna, and worships Me with his whole being.

shloka: इति गुह्यतमं शास्त्रमिदमुक्तं मयानघ। एतद्बुद्ध्वा बुद्धिमान्स्यात्कृतकृत्यश्च भारत॥
translation: Thus, this most secret scripture has been taught by Me, O sinless one. Understanding this, one becomes wise and fulfills all duties, O Arjuna.

shloka: श्रीभगवानुवाच। अभयं सत्त्वसंशुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थितिः। दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम्॥
translation: The Lord said: Fearlessness, purity of heart, steadfastness in knowledge and yoga, charity, self-control, sacrifice, study of scriptures, austerity, and straightforwardness—

shloka: अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधस्त्यागः शान्तिरपैशुनम्। दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम्॥
translation: Non-violence, truthfulness, absence of anger, renunciation, peacefulness, absence of fault-finding, compassion toward all beings, absence of greed, gentleness, modesty, and absence of fickleness—

shloka: तेजः क्षमा धृतिः शौचमद्रोहो नातिमानिता। भवन्ति संपदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत॥
translation: Vigor, forgiveness, fortitude, purity, absence of malice, and absence of pride—these belong to one born with divine wealth, O Arjuna.

shloka: दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोधः पारुष्यमेव च। अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ संपदमासुरीम्॥
translation: Hypocrisy, arrogance, conceit, anger, harshness, and ignorance—these belong to one born with demonic qualities, O Arjuna.

shloka: दैवी संपद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता। मा शुचः संपदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव॥
translation: The divine qualities lead to liberation, while the demonic qualities lead to bondage. Do not grieve, O Arjuna, for you are born with divine wealth.

shloka: द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च। दैवो विस्तरशः प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे शृणु॥
translation: There are two types of beings in this world—the divine and the demonic. The divine have been described at length; now hear from Me about the demonic, O Arjuna.

shloka: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुराः। न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते॥
translation: The demonic do not know what is to be done and what is not to be done. Neither purity, nor good conduct, nor truth is found in them.

shloka: असत्यमप्रतिष्ठं ते जगदाहुरनीश्वरम्। अपरस्परसंभूतं किमन्यत्कामहैतुकम्॥
translation: They say the world is unreal, without a foundation, without a God, brought about by mutual union, caused by lust, and nothing else.

shloka: एतां दृष्टिमवष्टभ्य नष्टात्मानोऽल्पबुद्धयः। प्रभवन्त्युग्रकर्माणः क्षयाय जगतोऽहिताः॥
translation: Holding this view, these lost souls of small intellect and fierce deeds arise as enemies for the destruction of the world.

shloka: काममाश्रित्य दुष्पूरं दम्भमानमदान्विताः। मोहाद्गृहीत्वासद्ग्राहान्प्रवर्तन्तेऽशुचिव्रताः॥
translation: Taking refuge in insatiable desire, filled with hypocrisy, pride, and arrogance, holding false views due to delusion, they act with impure vows.

shloka: चिन्तामपरिमेयां च प्रलयान्तामुपाश्रिताः। कामोपभोगपरमा एतावदिति निश्चिताः॥
translation: Obsessed with endless anxieties ending only with death, considering gratification of desires as the highest aim, convinced that this is all,

shloka: आशापाशशतैर्बद्धाः कामक्रोधपरायणाः। ईहन्ते कामभोगार्थमन्यायेनार्थसंचयान्॥
translation: Bound by hundreds of shackles of desire, given over to lust and anger, they strive to accumulate wealth unjustly for sensual pleasures.

shloka: इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम्। इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम्॥
translation: ‘This has been gained by me today; this desire I shall fulfill; this wealth is mine, and this also shall be mine in the future.’

shloka: असौ मया हतः शत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि। ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी॥
translation: ‘That enemy has been slain by me, and others also I shall slay. I am the lord, I am the enjoyer, I am perfect, powerful, and happy.’

shloka: आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया। यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिताः॥
translation: ‘I am wealthy and well-born; who else is equal to me? I shall sacrifice, I shall give, I shall rejoice.’ Thus deluded by ignorance,

shloka: अनेकचित्तविभ्रान्ता मोहजालसमावृताः। प्रसक्ताः कामभोगेषु पतन्ति नरकेऽशुचौ॥
translation: Bewildered by many thoughts, entangled in the net of delusion, addicted to sensual pleasures, they fall into a foul hell.

shloka: आत्मसंभाविताः स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विताः। यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम्॥
translation: Self-conceited, stubborn, filled with pride and arrogance of wealth, they perform sacrifices in name only, without following scriptural injunctions, out of hypocrisy.

shloka: अहंकारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिताः। मामात्मपरदेहेषु प्रद्विषन्तोऽभ्यसूयकाः॥
translation: Possessed by ego, strength, arrogance, lust, and anger, these malicious people hate Me in their own and others’ bodies.

shloka: तानहं द्विषतः क्रूरान्संसारेषु नराधमान्। क्षिपाम्यजस्रमशुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु॥
translation: Those cruel haters, the worst of men, I hurl perpetually into the wombs of demons in the cycle of birth and death.

shloka: आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि। मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम्॥
translation: Obtaining demonic wombs, deluded birth after birth, they do not attain Me, O Arjuna, but sink to the lowest state.

shloka: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः। कामः क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत्॥
translation: Lust, anger, and greed—these three are the gates to hell, leading to the soul's destruction. Therefore, one should abandon all three.

shloka: एतैर्विमुक्तः कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नरः। आचरत्यात्मनः श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम्॥
translation: One who is freed from these three gates of darkness, O Arjuna, does what is good for the soul and thus attains the supreme goal.

shloka: यः शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारतः। न स सिद्धिमवाप्नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम्॥
translation: But one who disregards scriptural injunctions and acts whimsically attains neither perfection, nor happiness, nor the supreme goal.

shloka: तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ। ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि॥
translation: Therefore, let the scriptures be your authority in determining what should be done and what should not be done. Knowing the scriptural injunctions, you should act accordingly.

shloka: अर्जुन उवाच। ये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः। तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तमः॥
translation: Arjuna said: O Krishna, what is the state of those who disregard scriptural injunctions but still worship with faith? Is it sattva, rajas, or tamas?

shloka: श्रीभगवानुवाच। त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा। सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां शृणु॥
translation: The Lord said: The faith of embodied beings is of three kinds—sattvic, rajasic, and tamasic—born of their inherent nature. Hear about them.

shloka: सत्त्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत। श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्धः स एव सः॥
translation: O Arjuna, a person's faith aligns with their inherent nature. One is made of faith; whatever one's faith is, that indeed they are.

shloka: यजन्ते सात्त्विका देवान्यक्षरक्षांसि राजसाः। प्रेतान्भूतगणांश्चान्ये यजन्ते तामसा जनाः॥
translation: Sattvic people worship the gods; rajasic people worship demigods and demons; tamasic people worship ghosts and spirits.

shloka: अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जनाः। दम्भाहंकारसंयुक्ताः कामरागबलान्विताः॥
translation: Those who practice severe austerities not enjoined by scripture, motivated by hypocrisy, ego, lust, and attachment, are foolish.

shloka: कर्षयन्तः शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतसः। मां चैवान्तःशरीरस्थं तान्विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान्॥
translation: They torture the elements within their bodies and Me dwelling within. Know them to be of demonic resolve.

shloka: आहारस्त्वपि सर्वस्य त्रिविधो भवति प्रियः। यज्ञस्तपस्तथा दानं तेषां भेदमिमं शृणु॥
translation: Even food is of three kinds, as are sacrifice, austerity, and charity. Hear the distinctions between them.

shloka: आयुःसत्त्वबलारोग्यसुखप्रीतिविवर्धनाः। रस्याः स्निग्धाः स्थिरा हृद्या आहाराः सात्त्विकप्रियाः॥
translation: Foods that promote longevity, virtue, strength, health, happiness, and joy—juicy, smooth, substantial, and nourishing—are dear to the sattvic.

shloka: कट्वम्ललवणात्युष्णतीक्ष्णरूक्षविदाहिनः। आहारा राजसस्येष्टा दुःखशोकामयप्रदाः॥
translation: Foods that are bitter, sour, salty, excessively hot, pungent, dry, and burning—causing pain, grief, and disease—are dear to the rajasic.

shloka: यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत्। उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम्॥
translation: Food that is stale, tasteless, putrid, rotten, and impure is dear to the tamasic.

shloka: अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदृष्टो य इज्यते। यष्टव्यमेवेति मनः समाधाय स सात्त्विकः॥
translation: A sacrifice performed as a duty, without desire for reward, in accordance with scripture, with a focused mind—that is sattvic.

shloka: अभिसन्धाय तु फलं दम्भार्थमपि चैव यत्। इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम्॥
translation: O Arjuna, a sacrifice performed ostentatiously, for the sake of reward or pride, is rajasic.

shloka: विधिहीनमसृष्टान्नं मन्त्रहीनमदक्षिणम्। श्रद्धाविरहितं यज्ञं तामसं परिचक्षते॥
translation: A sacrifice performed without scriptural guidance, without proper food, mantras, or charity, and without faith—is tamasic.

shloka: देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम्। ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते॥
translation: Worship of the gods, sages, teachers, and the wise; purity, honesty, celibacy, and non-violence—these constitute austerity of the body.

shloka: अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत्। स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाङ्मयं तप उच्यते॥
translation: Speech that causes no distress, is truthful, pleasant, beneficial, and regular recitation of scriptures—this is austerity of speech.

shloka: मनःप्रसादः सौम्यत्वं मौनमात्मविनिग्रहः। भावसंशुद्धिरित्येतत्तपो मानसमुच्यते॥
translation: Serenity of mind, gentleness, silence, self-control, and purity of thought—this is austerity of the mind.

shloka: श्रद्धया परया तप्तं तपस्तत्त्रिविधं नरैः। अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्युक्तैः सात्त्विकं परिचक्षते॥
translation: Austerity performed with supreme faith, without desire for reward, by those who are disciplined—is sattvic.

shloka: सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत्। क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम्॥
translation: Austerity performed for the sake of honor, respect, or pride is rajasic—unstable and impermanent.

shloka: मूढग्राहेणात्मनो यत्पीडया क्रियते तपः। परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्॥
translation: Austerity performed out of delusion, involving self-torture or harm to others, is tamasic.

shloka: दातव्यमिति यद्दानं दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे। देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम्॥
translation: Charity given as a duty, without expectation of return, at the right time and place, to a worthy recipient—is sattvic.

shloka: यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुनः। दीयते च परिक्लिष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम्॥
translation: Charity given with expectation of reward, or grudgingly, is rajasic.

shloka: अदेशकाले यद्दानमपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते। असत्कृतमवज्ञातं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्॥
translation: Charity given at the wrong time or place, to unworthy recipients, without respect or contemptuously—is tamasic.

shloka: ॐ तत्सदिति निर्देशो ब्रह्मणस्त्रिविधः स्मृतः। ब्राह्मणास्तेन वेदाश्च यज्ञाश्च विहिताः पुरा॥
translation: “Om Tat Sat”—this is the threefold designation of Brahman. The Vedas, sacrifices, and sacred duties were established in ancient times by this.

shloka: तस्मादोमित्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतपःक्रियाः। प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ताः सततं ब्रह्मवादिनाम्॥
translation: Thus, acts of sacrifice, charity, and austerity are always begun by the spiritually wise with the utterance of “Om,” following scriptural injunctions.

shloka: तदित्यनभिसन्धाय फलं यज्ञतपःक्रियाः। दानक्रियाश्च विविधाः क्रियन्ते मोक्षकाङ्क्षिभिः॥
translation: Without desiring rewards, those seeking liberation perform sacrifices, austerities, and acts of charity with the utterance of “Tat.”

shloka: सद्भावे साधुभावे च सदित्येतत्प्रयुज्यते। प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्दः पार्थ युज्यते॥
translation: The word “Sat” is used to denote goodness and virtue, O Arjuna. It is also used to describe auspicious actions.

shloka: यज्ञे तपसि दाने च स्थितिः सदिति चोच्यते। कर्म चैव तदर्थीयं सदित्येवाभिधीयते॥
translation: Steadfastness in sacrifice, austerity, and charity is called “Sat.” So too, actions dedicated to the Supreme are called “Sat.”

shloka: अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं कृतं च यत्। असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह॥
translation: Whatever is done without faith—sacrifice, charity, austerity—is called “asat” (unreal). It is worthless here and hereafter.

shloka: अर्जुन उवाच। संन्यासस्य महाबाहो तत्त्वमिच्छामि वेदितुम्। त्यागस्य च हृषीकेश पृथक्केशिनिषूदन॥
translation: Arjuna said: O mighty-armed Krishna, I wish to understand the truth of renunciation (sannyasa) and abandonment (tyaga), O Hrishikesha, slayer of the Keshī demon.

shloka: श्रीभगवानुवाच। काम्यानां कर्मणां न्यासं संन्यासं कवयो विदुः। सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं प्राहुस्त्यागं विचक्षणाः॥
translation: The Lord said: The wise understand sannyasa as the renunciation of desire-driven actions, while the learned declare tyaga as the abandonment of attachment to the fruits of all actions.

shloka: त्याज्यं दोषवदित्येके कर्म प्राहुर्मनीषिणः। यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यमिति चापरे॥
translation: Some sages declare that all actions should be abandoned as flawed, while others say that acts of sacrifice, charity, and austerity should never be abandoned.

shloka: निश्चयं शृणु मे तत्र त्यागे भरतसत्तम। त्यागो हि पुरुषव्याघ्र त्रिविधः संप्रकीर्तितः॥
translation: O best of the Bharatas, hear My conclusion on abandonment. Abandonment is declared to be of three kinds, O tiger among men.

shloka: यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यं कार्यमेव तत्। यज्ञो दानं तपश्चैव पावनानि मनीषिणाम्॥
translation: Acts of sacrifice, charity, and austerity must never be abandoned; they purify the wise.

shloka: एतान्यपि तु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलानि च। कर्तव्यानीति मे पार्थ निश्चितं मतमुत्तमम्॥
translation: These actions must be performed without attachment or expectation of reward, O Partha. This is My supreme conclusion.

shloka: नियतस्य तु संन्यासः कर्मणो नोपपद्यते। मोहात्तस्य परित्यागस्तामसः परिकीर्तितः॥
translation: Renunciation of prescribed duties is improper. Abandoning them out of delusion is declared to be tamasic.

shloka: दुःखमित्येव यत्कर्म कायक्लेशभयात्त्यजेत्। स कृत्वा राजसं त्यागं नैव त्यागफलं लभेत्॥
translation: One who abandons duty merely because it is difficult or painful, performs rajasic abandonment and does not attain the fruit of renunciation.

shloka: कार्यमित्येव यत्कर्म नियतं क्रियतेऽर्जुन। सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलं चैव स त्यागः सात्त्विको मतः॥
translation: O Arjuna, when one performs prescribed duty because it must be done, without attachment to the result, that abandonment is sattvic.

shloka: न द्वेष्ट्यकुशलं कर्म कुशले नानुषज्जते। त्यागी सत्त्वसमाविष्टो मेधावी छिन्नसंशयः॥
translation: The renunciant, filled with sattva, neither hates unpleasant work nor clings to pleasant work, being wise and free from doubt.

shloka: न हि देहभृता शक्यं त्यक्तुं कर्माण्यशेषतः। यस्तु कर्मफलत्यागी स त्यागीत्यभिधीयते॥
translation: It is impossible for an embodied being to abandon actions entirely. But one who renounces the fruits of action is a true renunciant.

shloka: अनिष्टमिष्टं मिश्रं च त्रिविधं कर्मणः फलम्। भवत्यत्यागिनां प्रेत्य न तु संन्यासिनां क्वचित्॥
translation: For those who do not renounce, the threefold results of action—pleasant, unpleasant, and mixed—accrue after death. But for renunciants, there are no such results.

shloka: पञ्चैतानि महाबाहो कारणानि निबोध मे। साङ्ख्ये कृतान्ते प्रोक्तानि सिद्धये सर्वकर्मणाम्॥
translation: O mighty-armed Arjuna, learn from Me the five factors that bring about the accomplishment of all actions, as stated in the Sankhya philosophy.

shloka: अधिष्ठानं तथा कर्ता करणं च पृथग्विधम्। विविधाश्च पृथक्चेष्टा दैवं चैवात्र पञ्चमम्॥
translation: The body (seat of action), the doer, the various senses, the different functions, and the divine will—these are the five factors of action.

shloka: शरीरवाङ्मनोभिर्यत्कर्म प्रारभते नरः। न्याय्यं वा विपरीतं वा पञ्चैते तस्य हेतवः॥
translation: Whatever action a person performs—right or wrong—with body, speech, or mind, these five are its causes.

shloka: तत्रैवं सति कर्तारमात्मानं केवलं तु यः। पश्यत्यकृतबुद्धित्वान्न स पश्यति दुर्मतिः॥
translation: One who, due to immature intellect, sees the self as the sole doer, such a foolish person does not perceive reality.

shloka: यस्य नाहंकृतो भावो बुद्धिर्यस्य न लिप्यते। हत्वाऽपि स इमाँल्लोकान्न हन्ति न निबध्यते॥
translation: One who is free from egoism, whose intelligence is unattached, even while slaying these worlds, neither kills nor is bound.

shloka: ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं परिज्ञाता त्रिविधा कर्मचोदना। करणं कर्म कर्तेति त्रिविधः कर्मसंग्रहः॥
translation: Knowledge, the object of knowledge, and the knower—these three prompt action. The instrument, the act, and the doer—these three constitute action.

shloka: ज्ञानं कर्म च कर्ता च त्रिधैव गुणभेदतः। प्रोच्यते गुणसङ्ख्याने यथावच्छृणु तान्यपि॥
translation: Knowledge, action, and the doer are of three kinds, according to the gunas. Hear about them as described in the science of the gunas.

shloka: सर्वभूतेषु येनैकं भावमव्ययमीक्षते। अविभक्तं विभक्तेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि सात्त्विकम्॥
translation: Knowledge by which one sees the one indestructible reality in all beings, undivided in the divided—know that as sattvic.

shloka: पृथक्त्वेन तु यज्ज्ञानं नानाभावान्पृथग्विधान्। वेत्ति सर्वेषु भूतेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि राजसम्॥
translation: Knowledge that sees multiplicity—different kinds of beings as separate—know that as rajasic.

shloka: यत्तु कृत्स्नवदेकस्मिन्कार्ये सक्तमहैतुकम्। अतत्त्वार्थवदल्पं च तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्॥
translation: Knowledge that is irrational, without basis in truth, trivial, and fixated on a single object as if it were all—that is tamasic.

shloka: नियतं सङ्गरहितमरागद्वेषतः कृतम्। अफलप्रेप्सुना कर्म यत्तत्सात्त्विकमुच्यते॥
translation: Action performed as duty, without attachment, free from love or hate, and without desire for reward—that is sattvic.

shloka: यत्तु कामेप्सुना कर्म साहंकारेण वा पुनः। क्रियते बहुलायासं तद्राजसमुदाहृतम्॥
translation: Action performed with great effort, out of desire or ego—that is rajasic.

shloka: अनुबन्धं क्षयं हिंसामनपेक्ष्य च पौरुषम्। मोहादारभ्यते कर्म यत्तत्तामसमुच्यते॥
translation: Action undertaken out of delusion, without regard for consequences, harm, or one’s capacity—that is tamasic.

shloka: मुक्तसङ्गोऽनहंवादी धृत्युत्साहसमन्वितः। सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योर्निर्विकारः कर्ता सात्त्विक उच्यते॥
translation: A doer who is free from attachment, non-egoistic, endowed with resolve and enthusiasm, and unaffected by success or failure—is sattvic.

shloka: रागी कर्मफलप्रेप्सुर्लुब्धो हिंसात्मकोऽशुचिः। हर्षशोकान्वितः कर्ता राजसः परिकीर्तितः॥
translation: A doer who is passionate, desirous of rewards, greedy, harmful, impure, and subject to joy and sorrow—is rajasic.

shloka: अयुक्तः प्राकृतः स्तब्धः शठो नैष्कृतिकोऽलसः। विषादी दीर्घसूत्री च कर्ता तामस उच्यते॥
translation: A doer who is undisciplined, vulgar, stubborn, deceitful, malicious, lazy, depressed, and procrastinating—is tamasic.

shloka: बुद्धेर्भेदं धृतेश्चैव गुणतस्त्रिविधं शृणु। प्रोच्यमानमशेषेण पृथक्त्वेन धनञ्जय॥
translation: O Dhananjaya, hear now the threefold division of intellect and resolve according to the gunas, as I explain them in detail.

shloka: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च कार्याकार्ये भयाभये। बन्धं मोक्षं च या वेत्ति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी॥
translation: O Partha, that intellect which discerns right and wrong action, fear and fearlessness, bondage and liberation—is sattvic.

shloka: या धर्ममधर्मं च कार्यं चाकार्यमेव च। अयथावत्प्रजानाति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ राजसी॥
translation: O Partha, that intellect which confuses dharma and adharma, right and wrong action—is rajasic.

shloka: अधर्मं धर्ममिति या मन्यते तमसाऽऽवृता। सर्वार्थान्विपरीतांश्च बुद्धिः सा पार्थ तामसी॥
translation: O Partha, that intellect which, shrouded in darkness, sees adharma as dharma and everything perverted—is tamasic.

shloka: धृत्या यया धारयते मनःप्राणेन्द्रियक्रियाः। योगेनाव्यभिचारिण्या धृतिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी॥
translation: O Partha, that unwavering resolve by which one regulates the mind, life force, and senses through yoga—is sattvic.

shloka: या तु धर्मकामार्थान्धृत्या धारयतेऽर्जुन। प्रसङ्गेन फलाकाङ्क्षी धृतिः सा पार्थ राजसी॥
translation: O Arjuna, that resolve by which one clings to dharma, desire, and wealth out of attachment, craving rewards—is rajasic.

shloka: या स्वप्नं भयं शोकं विषादं मदमेव च। न विमुञ्चति दुर्मेधा धृतिः सा पार्थ तामसी॥
translation: O Partha, that resolve by which a foolish person does not abandon sleep, fear, grief, despair, and arrogance—is tamasic.

shloka: सुखं त्विदानीं त्रिविधं शृणु मे भरतर्षभ। अभ्यासाद्रमते यत्र दुःखान्तं च निगच्छति॥
translation: O best of the Bharatas, hear from Me now about the threefold happiness, by which one rejoices through practice and reaches the end of sorrow.

shloka: यत्तदग्रे विषमिव परिणामेऽमृतोपमम्। तत्सुखं सात्त्विकं प्रोक्तमात्मबुद्धिप्रसादजम्॥
translation: That which is like poison in the beginning but nectar in the end—that happiness is sattvic, born of the clarity of self-realization.

shloka: विषयेन्द्रियसंयोगाद्यत्तदग्रेऽमृतोपमम्। परिणामे विषमिव तत्सुखं राजसं स्मृतम्॥
translation: That happiness which arises from contact of senses with objects—nectar-like at first but poison-like in the end—is rajasic.

shloka: यदग्रे चानुबन्धे च सुखं मोहनमात्मनः। निद्रालस्यप्रमादोत्थं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्॥
translation: That happiness which deludes the self, arising from sleep, laziness, and heedlessness—is tamasic.

shloka: न तदस्ति पृथिव्यां वा दिवि देवेषु वा पुनः। सत्त्वं प्रकृतिजैर्मुक्तं यदेभिः स्यात्त्रिभिर्गुणैः॥
translation: There is no being on earth or among the gods in heaven free from the three gunas born of material nature.

shloka: ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियविशां शूद्राणां च परन्तप। कर्माणि प्रविभक्तानि स्वभावप्रभवैर्गुणैः॥
translation: O scorcher of foes, the duties of Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras are distributed according to their innate qualities.

shloka: शमो दमस्तपः शौचं क्षान्तिरार्जवमेव च। ज्ञानं विज्ञानमास्तिक्यं ब्रह्मकर्म स्वभावजम्॥
translation: Serenity, self-control, austerity, purity, patience, honesty, wisdom, knowledge, and faith—these are the natural duties of a Brahmin.

shloka: शौर्यं तेजो धृतिर्दाक्ष्यं युद्धे चाप्यपलायनम्। दानमीश्वरभावश्च क्षात्रं कर्म स्वभावजम्॥
translation: Heroism, power, determination, resourcefulness, courage in battle, generosity, and leadership—these are the natural duties of a Kshatriya.

shloka: कृषिगौरक्ष्यवाणिज्यं वैश्यकर्म स्वभावजम्। परिचर्यात्मकं कर्म शूद्रस्यापि स्वभावजम्॥
translation: Farming, cattle-rearing, and trade are the natural duties of a Vaishya, while service is the natural duty of a Shudra.

shloka: स्वे स्वे कर्मण्यभिरतः संसिद्धिं लभते नरः। स्वकर्मनिरतः सिद्धिं यथा विन्दति तच्छृणु॥
translation: By devotedly performing one’s own duty, a person attains perfection. Hear how one achieves success through dedicated duty.

shloka: यतः प्रवृत्तिर्भूतानां येन सर्वमिदं ततम्। स्वकर्मणा तमभ्यर्च्य सिद्धिं विन्दति मानवः॥
translation: By worshipping the Supreme, from whom all beings arise and by whom all this is pervaded, one attains perfection through one’s own duty.

shloka: श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात्। स्वभावनियतं कर्म कुर्वन्नाप्नोति किल्बिषम्॥
translation: Better is one’s own duty, though imperfect, than another’s duty well-performed. Performing duty prescribed by one’s nature, one incurs no sin.

shloka: सहजं कर्म कौन्तेय सदोषमपि न त्यजेत्। सर्वारम्भा हि दोषेण धूमेनाग्निरिवावृताः॥
translation: O Kaunteya, one should not abandon duty, though flawed, for all undertakings are veiled by faults, as fire by smoke.

shloka: असक्तबुद्धिः सर्वत्र जितात्मा विगतस्पृहः। नैष्कर्म्यसिद्धिं परमां संन्यासेनाधिगच्छति॥
translation: One whose intellect is unattached everywhere, who has mastered the self, and is free from desires, attains the supreme perfection of renunciation through abandonment of action.

shloka: सिद्धिं प्राप्तो यथा ब्रह्म तथाप्नोति निबोध मे। समासेनैव कौन्तेय निष्ठा ज्ञानस्य या परा॥
translation: O Kaunteya, learn from Me briefly how one who has attained perfection also attains Brahman, the supreme state of knowledge.

shloka: बुद्ध्या विशुद्धया युक्तो धृत्यात्मानं नियम्य च। शब्दादीन्विषयांस्त्यक्त्वा रागद्वेषौ व्युदस्य च॥
translation: Endowed with purified intellect, restraining the self with firmness, abandoning sense objects, free from attraction and hatred,

shloka: विविक्तसेवी लघ्वाशी यतवाक्कायमानसः। ध्यानयोगपरो नित्यं वैराग्यं समुपाश्रितः॥
translation: Living in solitude, eating lightly, controlling speech, body, and mind, ever absorbed in meditation, taking refuge in detachment,

shloka: अहंकारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं परिग्रहम्। विमुच्य निर्ममः शान्तो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते॥
translation: Free from ego, power, arrogance, lust, anger, and possessiveness, serene and selfless—one becomes fit for oneness with Brahman.

shloka: ब्रह्मभूतः प्रसन्नात्मा न शोचति न काङ्क्षति। समः सर्वेषु भूतेषु मद्भक्तिं लभते पराम्॥
translation: United with Brahman, the serene one neither grieves nor desires. Equal to all beings, one attains supreme devotion to Me.

shloka: भक्त्या मामभिजानाति यावान्यश्चास्मि तत्त्वतः। ततो मां तत्त्वतो ज्ञात्वा विशते तदनन्तरम्॥
translation: By devotion, one truly knows Me—My essence and magnitude. Knowing Me thus, one enters into My being immediately.

shloka: सर्वकर्माण्यपि सदा कुर्वाणो मद्व्यपाश्रयः। मत्प्रसादादवाप्नोति शाश्वतं पदमव्ययम्॥
translation: Though engaged in all actions, taking refuge in Me, by My grace one attains the eternal, imperishable abode.

shloka: चेतसा सर्वकर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्परः। बुद्धियोगमुपाश्रित्य मच्चित्तः सततं भव॥
translation: Mentally dedicating all actions to Me, being devoted to Me, take refuge in the yoga of intellect, and fix your mind constantly on Me.

shloka: मच्चित्तः सर्वदुर्गाणि मत्प्रसादात्तरिष्यसि। अथ चेत्त्वमहंकारान्न श्रोष्यसि विनङ्क्ष्यसि॥
translation: With your consciousness fixed on Me, you will overcome all obstacles by My grace. But if from ego you refuse to listen, you will perish.

shloka: यदहंकारमाश्रित्य न योत्स्य इति मन्यसे। मिथ्यैष व्यवसायस्ते प्रकृतिस्त्वां नियोक्ष्यति॥
translation: If, motivated by ego, you think, ‘I shall not fight,’ your resolve is vain—nature will compel you.

shloka: स्वभावजेन कौन्तेय निबद्धः स्वेन कर्मणा। कर्तुं नेच्छसि यन्मोहात्करिष्यस्यवशोऽपि तत्॥
translation: O Kaunteya, bound by your own nature-born duty, what you wish not to do out of delusion, you will do helplessly.

shloka: ईश्वरः सर्वभूतानां हृद्देशेऽर्जुन तिष्ठति। भ्रामयन्सर्वभूतानि यन्त्रारूढानि मायया॥
translation: The Lord dwells in the hearts of all beings, O Arjuna, causing them to revolve as if mounted on a machine by His Maya.

shloka: तमेव शरणं गच्छ सर्वभावेन भारत। तत्प्रसादात्परां शान्तिं स्थानं प्राप्स्यसि शाश्वतम्॥
translation: Take refuge in Him alone with all your being, O Bharata. By His grace, you will attain supreme peace and the eternal abode.

shloka: इति ते ज्ञानमाख्यातं गुह्याद्गुह्यतरं मया। विमृश्यैतदशेषेण यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु॥
translation: Thus, I have explained to you this knowledge, more secret than secrecy itself. Reflect on it fully, then act as you wish.

shloka: सर्वगुह्यतमं भूयः शृणु मे परमं वचः। इष्टोऽसि मे दृढमिति ततो वक्ष्यामि ते हितम्॥
translation: Hear again My supreme word, the most secret of all. Because you are dearly beloved to Me, I shall speak for your benefit.

shloka: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु। मामेवैष्यसि युक्त्वैवमात्मानं मत्परायणः॥
translation: Fix your mind on Me, be devoted to Me, worship Me, and bow to Me. Doing so, you will surely come to Me—this is My pledge, for you are dear to Me.

shloka: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज। अहं त्वां सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः॥
translation: Abandon all varieties of dharma and surrender unto Me alone. I shall liberate you from all sins; do not fear.

shloka: य इदं परमं गुह्यं मद्भक्तेष्वभिधास्यति। भक्तिं मयि परां कृत्वा मामेवैष्यत्यसंशयः॥
translation: Whoever imparts this supreme secret to My devotees, performing the highest devotion, shall without doubt come to Me alone.

shloka: न च तस्मान्मनुष्येषु कश्चिन्मे प्रियकृत्तमः। भविता न च मे तस्मादन्यः प्रियतरो भुवि॥
translation: No one among men does more pleasing service to Me than he, nor shall anyone on earth be dearer to Me.
